item.title: ペンタゴンの「爆発」偽画像が流行した後、Twitterは画像に「最近と未来の一致画像」などのコミュニティノートを追加（Mia Sato/The Verge）
item.description:
Mia Sato / The Verge:
After a fake Pentagon “explosion” image went viral, Twitter adds Community Notes to images, including “recent and future matching images”  —  Twitter is expanding its crowdsourced fact-checking program to include images, shortly after a fake image went viral claiming to show an “explosion” near the Pentagon.

item.title: マサ・アミニの死を取材した2人の女性ジャーナリストの裁判を前に、イランの記者たちは、国内の抗議活動を取材したことによる殴打や脅迫について説明する（Deepa Parent/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Deepa Parent / The Guardian:
Ahead of a trial of two female journalists who covered Mahsa Amini's death, Iran's reporters describe beatings and threats for covering protests in the country  —  Ahead of a trial of journalists who covered the death of Mahsa Jina Amini, reporters describe beatings and threats as government agents try to wipe out independent media

item.title: 英国では、イングランド・プレミアリーグの試合を違法にストリーミング配信するために月額10ポンドのサブスクリプションを販売し、5万人のサブスクライバーから700万ポンド以上の収益を得た5人の男性が投獄された（BBC）
item.description:
BBC:
The UK jails five men who sold a £10 per month subscription to illegally stream English Premier League games, generating over £7M from 50K subscribers  —  Five men who illegally streamed Premier League football matches to tens of thousands of people have been jailed.

item.title: オウム：アジア言語の映画やテレビ番組の世界的な需要は、中国と日本のコンテンツが牽引し、2020年第1四半期の～15％から、2023年第1四半期には25％のシェアに達する（Lillian Rizzo/CNBC）
item.description:
Lillian Rizzo / CNBC:
Parrot: global demand for films and TV shows in Asian languages reached a 25% share in Q1 2023, up from ~15% in Q1 2020, driven by Chinese and Japanese content  —  WATCH NOW  —  Netflix is investing $2.5 billion to make Korean shows, says VP of Korean content

item.title: Cox Media、Fox Corp、CBSの3社は、放送テレビのスポット広告の価格操作に関する反トラスト法上の主張を解決するため、合計$48Mを支払うことに合意、Coxは$37Mを支払う (Mike Scarcella/Reuters)
item.description:
Mike Scarcella / Reuters:
Cox Media, Fox Corp, and CBS agree to pay a combined $48M to settle antitrust claims of price fixing for spot advertising on broadcast TV; Cox will pay $37M  —  Cox Media Group LLC, Fox Corp (FOXA.O) and CBS Corp have agreed to pay a combined $48 million to resolve civil antitrust claims …

item.title: 米連邦破産法11条のシンクレアのダイヤモンドスポーツ、サンディエゴ・パドレスの放送権を失効させる、MLBアプリでの一時的な無料配信が有力（Jeff Sanders/San Diego Union-Tribune）。
item.description:
Jeff Sanders / San Diego Union-Tribune:
Sinclair's Diamond Sports, in Chapter 11 bankruptcy, lets its broadcast rights to the San Diego Padres expire; temporary free streams on the MLB app are likely  —  Temporary free streams on the MLB app are likely, while both direct-to-consumer and traditional cable options are pursued

item.title: ソースはこちらTwitterは5月13日から1つのテストマーケットでモバイル広告マーケットプレイスInMobiを通じて広告在庫を販売しており、徐々に拡大する予定（Digiday）。
item.description:
Digiday:
Source: Twitter has been selling ad inventory through the mobile advertising marketplace InMobi in one test market since May 13, and plans to gradually expand  —  Twitter's beleaguered ads business is on a bit of a roll these days.  —  With the appointment of a top media executive …

item.title: Report for AmericaはInvestigative Editing Corpsと提携し、ホストとなるニュースルームで2年間にわたり、それぞれ3〜6ヶ月で最大10件のプロジェクトを監督する（For America/Report for America）。
item.description:
For America / Report for America:
Report for America partners with Investigative Editing Corps to oversee up to 10 projects, each taking three to six months, over two years in its host newsrooms  —  To encourage more investigative reporting in local newsrooms and to help local reporters hone those skills …

item.title: 倫理的に問題のないジャーナリストの理想郷を作ろうとするDefectorと、それに伴う収益の減少や情報源の減少などのトレードオフについて（Danny Funt/Columbia Journalism Review）。
item.description:
Danny Funt / Columbia Journalism Review:
A look at Defector trying to create a journalists' utopia that isn't ethically compromised and the accompanying trade-offs, like less revenue and fewer sources  —  Defector in pursuit of a journalists' utopia  —  Deadspin, the influential sports and culture blog that all but imploded a few years ago …

item.title: 情報源はこちらインドは、国内にいる最後の中国人ジャーナリスト2人のビザ更新を拒否した。2022年に中国にいる4人のインド人ジャーナリストのうち、少なくとも2人は帰国できない（Keith Zhai/Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Keith Zhai / Wall Street Journal:
Sources: India denied visa renewals to the last two Chinese journalists in the country; of 2022's four Indian journalists in China, at least two can't return  —  Rift that opened with deadly border clash deepens as neighbors deny reporter visas  —  SINGAPORE—India and China …

item.title: [スレッド】ブルーチェックのTwitterユーザーがThe Guardianにリンクし、TVプレゼンターのイアン・ライトが死亡したと偽ったAI生成の広告がTwitterの問題を浮き彫りにする（Emily Bell/@emilybell)
item.description:
Emily Bell / @emilybell:
[Thread] An AI-generated ad from a blue-check Twitter user linking to The Guardian and falsely saying TV presenter Ian Wright died highlights Twitter's issues  —  Welcome to the @elonmusk advertising nightmare. Friend sent me this tweet asking wtaf the @guardian url is doing on this weird AI generated ad suggesting (incorrectly) that Ian Wright is dead . The link goes to an old page on the Guardian site 1/ [image]

item.title: トルコのラジオ・テレビ最高評議会、選挙を蔑視した報道を行ったとされる野党系テレビ局7社に対する調査を開始（Duvar English）
item.description:
Duvar English:
Turkey's Radio and Television Supreme Council launches investigations against seven opposition TV channels for their allegedly derogatory election coverage  —  Turkey's Radio and Television Supreme Council (RTÜK) announced that an investigation was launched against opposition channels Fox TV …

item.title: 騒乱の火種となったマフサ・アミニの死を報じたとして、イランが「敵対勢力と結託した」と非難したエラヘ・モハマディの裁判が5月29日に始まった（ロイター）。
item.description:
Reuters:
The trial of Elaheh Mohammadi, who Iran accused of “colluding with hostile powers” for reporting on Mahsa Amini, whose death sparked unrest, began on May 29  —  An Iranian journalist went of trial behind closed doors on Monday on charges linked to her coverage of the funeral …

item.title: 南極大陸の科学研究を伝える、アメリカ政府出資の南極大陸最大・最長寿の新聞「Antarctic Sun」を見てみる（Ben Mack/Esquire）
item.description:
Ben Mack / Esquire:
A look at the US government-funded Antarctic Sun, Antarctica's biggest and longest-running newspaper, which covers scientific research on the continent  —  Meet the one-person team behind Antarctica's longest-running newspaper, the Antarctic Sun.  —  The whipping wind wasn't letting up in the Allan Hills.

item.title: 情報筋の話：Financial Timesの編集者Roula Khalafは、元GuardianのコラムニストNick Cohenの不要な誘いの疑惑に関する記事を、「FTの記事」でないことを理由に削除した（Jane Bradley/New York Times）。
item.description:
Jane Bradley / New York Times:
Sources: Financial Times editor Roula Khalaf killed a story on allegations of ex-Guardian columnist Nick Cohen's unwanted advances, over not being an “FT story”  —  Seven women say that a star columnist groped them or made unwanted sexual advances.
